article.author: Antiphon Freeman
article.mainText: Trumpâ€™s Campaign Manager was interrupted on CNN by Anderson Cooper after she said, â€œyouâ€™ve got all these little baby girls being killed just because theyâ€™re girls in this country.â€ Without letting her finish, Anderson immediately stopped her: â€œWait, what Excuse me, where is that happening?â€ She then went on and tried to back up her statement by citing Planned Parenthood data, which was supposedly collected by the Guttmacher Institute report. But, Anderson Cooper wasnâ€™t buying it. â€œBut statistically, thereâ€™s not really much evidence that that is actually occurring in the United States,â€ Cooper said. â€œAmongst some immigrant groups in small numbers it may be occurring but in no statistical measure is it significant.â€ Then â€“ right after commercial break â€“ Anderson Cooper again came back in order to set the record straight. The only thing Trumpâ€™s campaign manager could do was force a fakeÂ smile. â€œBefore the break, Kellyanne, you mentioned the Guttmacher Institute information on sex-selective abortion in the United States,â€ Cooper said. â€œHereâ€™s what they actually say in a May 30 press release titled â€˜Sex Selective Abortion Bans: A Disingenuous New Strategy to Limit Womenâ€™s Access to Abortion.â€™â€ â€œThe study acknowledges the practice does go on overseas, as we mentioned, and perhaps in certain Asian-American communities in the United States in small numbers,â€ Copper continued. â€œBut, quote, â€˜In the United States, meanwhile, there is limited data indicating that sex-selective abortion may be occurring in some Asian communities. Although the U.S. sex ratio at 1.05 males for every female is squarely within biologically normal parameters.â€™ So I just wanted to put that out there.â€
article.title: WATCH: Trumpâ€™s Manager Gets Instantly Shut Down For Saying â€˜Baby Girls Are Killed For Their Sexâ€™
